column10: child on bike riding in crosswalk hit by driver heading east, causing life-threatening injuries
Crossed first 2 with no approaching traffic, but was stuck standing in the turn lane as westbound traffic failed to yield to me and my dog
Cars are frequently going 45mph+ going east/westbound on Jermantown Rd. near Borge St. Park and failing to yield to pedestrians crossing the crosswalk.
Crossing Blake south with driver turning left on Edgelea blocking crosswalk; driver turning left onto Blake from Platten nearly hit me in the crosswalk (vision blocked by other car)
Crossing S across Blake from Edgelea to Platten; crossed first 2 westbound lanes and Edglelea turn lane fine, had to stop in street at east bound (4th) lane as car approaching failed to yield

Every day at this intersection, drivers turn R on red despite signs that say not when pedestrians are present and every time I cross if there is a car therewhen it turns green, cars turn right into my path as a pedestrian.

really need leading ped interval; crossing NE on 123 on south side across Jermantown; walk signal coincides with green right turn arrow; I stepped into crosswalk on walk signal and car turned right into my path on green turn signal
Driver turning left onto Blake from Platten nearly hit me as I crossed Blake in the. Crosswalk
Crossing Blake south from Edgelea to Platten and got stuck in third lane of 5 with drivers failing to yield
driver turning left onto Blake from 123 failed to yield to me in the crosswalk; I was running NE
2 children killed (1 severely injured, 5 injured in all) by speeding driver
Speeding driver nearly rear-ended car that yielded to me in lane 4 of 5 as I was crossing north
Car in left westbound lane yielded to me and my dog but car in right lane did not and nearly hit us as they passed the stopped car on its right
walking my bike South across Blake at Hibbard. Crossed 2 lanes and had to stop in 3rd as cars in remaining to lanes refused to yield
Driver wasn't making eye contact as I and my 6 year old were biking across Blake Lane, so we stopped in the middle of the crosswalk to let the careless driver drive through the red light.
Crossing heading northeast. Driver approaching 123 did not yield to me in the crosswalk until the last second. Would have hit me if I had not stopped. Crosswalk is unmarked.

Relatively new crosswalk at this location is on a curve with very limited visibility, particularly for people driving north towards Blake. Pedestrians crossing east to west must enter roadway/bike lane in order to gain visibility to cars approaching's around the curve at high speeds. Have witnessed several near misses (some involving children) at this location - myself included. Frequently used access point to Blake Lane Park.

Crossing Cyrandall Valley Rd from E to W and hesitated to enter the crosswalk as there was a car waiting to turn right onto Blake. Driver's eyes and attention was entirely on the traffic approaching to his left, and he never looked right. Accelerated through crosswalk without ever looking to his right - would have been hit had I entered the crosswalk as the driver did not look to see if his path was clear before accelerating.
column21: There is no stop bar or marked crosswalk at this intersection.

column10: Car accident involving two vehicles. Debris in road and on sidewalk. Portions of one lane blocked by car/accident requiring cars to go around in other lane.  Police not on scene.
column21: Not yet designated a school zone; left turn onto Sutton from blake-especially during heavy traffic and higher speeds creates accidents there and unsafe for pedestrians and other drivers in that intersection

column10: Crossing N to S and got stuck standing in turn lane with Eastbound drivers failing to yield in near passing a driver who had stopped for me in far lane
Crossed 2 lanes in crosswalk and waited in turn lane for drivers to yield. Eventually driver in near lane stopped but several others in far lane drove past stopped car through crosswalk

Jermantown Rd in Oakton from Chain Bridge to Sutton is extremely dangerous in the evening hours. Myself and family members have taken walks along the south side of this road (starting from Trevor House and going east or west) and have had around 6 close calls and 1 actual physical tap (at Borge St) from unsafe drivers pulling in or out of side streets and parking lots and we JUST moved here last November 2022 (it is Marxh 2023 now). Too many! We walk with flashlights now and are considering reflective gear because it seems like the street lights just aren't enough even when we are directly under them - even flashlights don't catch the eye of drivers sometimes. Drivers making a fast left from westbound turn southward across the traffic onto side streets (closer to the Sutton) and drivers pulling out of the Treebrooke parking lot for example (near Borge) are particularly bad.
column26: 10202 Willow Mist Ct, Unit B, Oakton, VA 22124

column10: Crossing Jermantown in crosswalk with walk signal and driver turning right took a right turn in front of me through the crosswalk
column21: No dedicated pedestrian phase, so pedestrians and drivers are always in conflict
